questionText:
Which of the following statement(s) represent(s) Aristotle's view on reality?
(1) Sensible objects are eternal.
(2) Existence of sensible objects depends on forms.
(3) Reality is not found in the realm of forms.

answerChoice: ‘form’ represents the properties of sensible objects.
‘matter’ can be reduced to  four elements.
‘form’ is the perfect idea of a sensible object.

questionText: In Aristotle’s view of the universe, the order of the five elements starting from the centre of the universe is:
